N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 651.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms whenever used in this Chapter, except as
otherwise specifically intended, shall be defined to mean and shall be held to
include each of the meanings herein below specifically set forth, and any such
terms used in the singular number shall be held to include the plural: (a) Commission. The Lake Champlain Bridge

Commission. (b) Employee. The toll
collectors and such other individuals designated by the commission as special
officers for the direction and control of traffic. (c) Bridges. The Lake Champlain Bridge, between Crown Point, New York, and Chimney Point, Vermont, and the Rouses Point

Bridge, between Rouses Point, New York, and Alburg, Vermont, including the
embankments on land and in water on which the approach highways maintained by
the commission are built. (d) Roadway. All that portion of the bridges designed for the use of
vehicles. (e) Curbing. All that
portion of the bridges consisting of concrete, or concrete and steel, on the
sides of the roadway and raised to a slight elevation above it. (f) Draw zone. All that portion of the Rouses

Point Bridge, consisting of the moveable span and the adjacent fixed spans in
each end thereof which lie between the two roadway gates. (g) Pedestrians. All foot passengers on the
bridges who have paid toll or are actually proceeding toward the regular toll
collection booths for the purpose of crossing and paying toll
therefor. (h) Vehicle. That in or on
which anything is carried. (i) Passenger auto. Includes every type of motor driven vehicle used for the
transportation of passengers and registered as such, but excluding
buses. (j) Truck. Includes every
type of motor driven vehicle used for commercial purposes and registered as
such. (k) Trailer. A vehicle without
motive power, drawn by a motor driven vehicle. (l) Motorcycle. Includes all motor operated
vehicles of the bicycle or tricycle type. (m) Driver. A person who propels or operates
or who is in charge of a vehicle. (n) Toll zones. Such space at or near the
toll house as has been established for the collection of
tolls. Notes
